info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:35PM CDT until May 06 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CLAY...NORTHWESTERN NUCKOLLS...NORTHEASTERN WEBSTER...SOUTHERN ADAMS AND SOUTHEASTERN KEARNEY COUNTIES... At 734 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Norman, or 20 miles southwest of Hastings, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported quarter size hail south of Minden. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Bladen and Roseland around 745 PM CDT. Blue Hill and Ayr around 755 PM CDT. Glenvil around 805 PM CDT. Lawrence around 810 PM CDT. Fairfield and Deweese around 815 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
